definition: to give away/to accompany/to see sb off
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send

sentences.english: The old chart should accompany the patient from the ER to the patient ward where he's admitted.
sentences.chinese: 舊病歷應伴着病人從急診室送人病房。

sentences.english: Blessed eggs Eggs that are dyed red can be gifts for others.
sentences.chinese: 喜蛋》雞蛋塗上了大紅色，當地人送人的禮物。

sentences.english: Saturn was to launch the 15 th flight, a Moon orbital mission.
sentences.chinese: 第15次飛行利用薩杜恩將飛船送人月球軌道。

sentences.english: Mother dare(d) not tell father she'd given away his old jacket.
sentences.chinese: 母親不敢告訴父親她把他的舊上衣送人了。

sentences.english: The theme of poetry about seeing off someone going to his post dominates a great proportion of all poems in Tang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 送人赴任之作，在唐代別離詩中佔有相當大比例。

sentences.english: But the currency kept sinking, till nobody would take it as a gift;
sentences.chinese: 可是貨幣不斷貶值，到後來連當禮物送人也沒人要了。

sentences.english: Talk about mother in this time, to find out that year for children.
sentences.chinese: 談母這次來，就是爲了找到當年送人的孩子。

sentences.english: After the oil and gas separator separation, to send people to use a network, for the user.
sentences.chinese: 經過油氣分離器分離後，送人管網，供用戶使用。

definition: to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
to send/to give as a present
to sell off/to get rid of in a sale
to resign oneself to part with what one treasures
to deliver/to carry/to give (as a present)/to present (with)/to see off/to send
to part with sth cherished/to forsake
don't bother to see me out
